Name: 2,4,5,2',4',5'-HEXABROMOBIPHENYL
Description: 2,2',4,4',5,5'-hexabromobiphenyl is a polybromobiphenyl that is biphenyl in which the hydrogens at positions 2, 2', 4, 4', 5, and 5' have been replace by bromines. It is a polybromobiphenyl and a brominated flame retardant.

animal_concentrations.References: (1) Jansson B et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 12: 1163-74 (1993)
animal_concentrations.Value: The concn of 2,2',4,4',5,5'-hexabromobiphenyl in reindeer, ringed seal, grey seal, and osprey from Sweden (collected between 1982-1987) were 0.037, 0.42, 26, and 22 ng/g lipid, respectively(1).

fish_seafood_concentrations.References: (1) Jansson B et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 12: 1163-74 (1993)
fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: The concn of 2,2',4,4',5,5'-hexabromobiphenyl in whitefish, arctic char, herring (Bothnian Sea), herring (Baltic Proper), and herring (Skagerrak) from Sweden (collected between 1981-1987) were 0.29, 0.42, 0.092, 0.16, and 0.27 ng/g lipid, respectively(1).

fish_seafood_concentrations.References: (1) de Boer J et al; Handbook of Environmental Chemistry 3(K): 61-95 (2000)
fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: 2,2',4,4',5,5'-Hexabrombiphenyl concns ranged from 0.2-4.2 mg/kg fat in samples from fish obtained from the Baltic Sea(1).

logP.References: Veith GD et al; J Fish Res Board Can 36: 1040-1047 (1979)

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: IARC. Monographs on the Evaluation of the Carcinogenic Risk  of Chemicals to Humans. Geneva: World Health Organization,  International Agency for Research on Cancer, 1972-PRESENT.  (Multivolume work). Available at: https://monographs.iarc.fr/ENG/Classification/index.php, p. V18: 112 (1978)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SOIL: At farm with contaminated dairy herd (0.2-0.3 mg/L in milk), concentrations of PBBs was measured in manured soil samples taken at 3 different locations in field approximately 1 yr after contamination. Major PBB component isomer (2,2',4,4'5,5'-hexabromobiphenyl) were found in concentration of 4.1, 5.7 and 4.4 ug/kg.

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Jacobs LW et al; Environ Health Perspect 28: 1-8 (1978)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SOIL: Soil samples from 30 farms located in Michigan heavily contaminated with Firemaster BP-6 contained polybrominated biphenyl (PBBs) at levels of 0.1 to 224 ppb(1). Although levels of hexabromobiphenyl were not quantified in these samples, 2,2',4,4',5,5'-hexabromobiphenyl is the main constituent of Firemaster BP-6 and is likely to be the primary contaminant in the soils.
